info.title: 4i PECOS Provider API (Public)
info.description:
Provider Enrollment, Chain, and Ownership System (PECOS) data is used to verify Provider & Supplier Enrollment Status, Medicare Exclusion Status, Reassignment List, and various Medicare provider enrollment requirements for entities to participate in CMMI Models. 

Currently CMMI models send files to the Center for Program Integrity and the CPI Vetting Contractor (CPI/Acumen) to verify status initiating a manual process that takes approximately 2 weeks to return the vetting results for models. This process do not allow CMMI models and supporting applications to offer real-time or near real-time feedback for participating entities resulting in longer onboarding and vetting process.

To support real time vetting process and thus enable real time feedback, 4i System relies on Provider Vetting API built by Softrams on top of PECOS Global Extract Data. This API enablement allows to offer automated and real time verification of provider information for vetting process for various CMMI Models supported within in 4i. 

This generic API can be used by other CMMI models for provider vetting process outside 4i System.

> PECOS Global Extract Data is refreshed every 24 hours.

post.description: Retrieve API Access Token and must request for scope 'pecos' in order to use API end points described in this specification.
Fetch enrollment TIN for a given billing TIN (for sole proprietor type businesses) and NPI.

Retrieve Solo Practitioner (Individual Provider) Provider data, includes but not limited to mid-level Clinicians
such as Physician Assistants and Nurse Practitioners.

Returned data includes Medicare Exclusion Check, Active Enrollment Check, PTAN and Legal Business Name.

Retrieves Institutional Provider data, includes Part A Hospitals, Dialysis Facilities, Skilled Nursing Facilities (SNF), but exclude FQHC, RHC and CAH providers.

Returned data includes Medicare Exclusion Check, Active Enrollment Check, Legal Business Name, one or more CCN and CCN Legal Business Names.

> Please note that CCN is required to identify the provider, so must verify CCN value returned.

Retrieves Institutional Provider data, includes only FQHC, RHC and CAH providers.

Returned data includes Medicare Exclusion Check, Active Enrollment Check, Legal Business Name, one or more CCN and CCN Legal Business Names.

> Please note that CCN is required to identify the provider, so must verify CCN value returned.

Retrieves Organizational Provider data, includes all Part B providers such as Group Practices.

Returned data includes Medicare Exclusion Check, Active Enrollment Check, PTAN and Legal Business Name.

Retrieves Physicians working at FQHC, RHC and CAH.

Returned data includes Medicare Exclusion Check, Active Enrollment Check, PTAN and Legal Business Name.

example.responseTxt: No data found for the given Input

AccessToken.description: Use OAUTH2 Client Credentials flow to retrieve access token and use Access Token to access end points

tags.name: Authorization
tags.description:
4i PECOS API uses OAUTH2 client credentials flow. API Consumer applications must first be registered with 4i Identity Management (IDM) to obtain client_id and client_secret. 

Each API Key is restricted up to 10 white listed source IP addresses or CIDR blocks and explicitly requested resource scopes. While obtaining access token, it is possible to use one or more resource scopes from the permitted resource list.

> This Provider Vetting API requires "pecos" resource scope.

tags.name: Provider Vetting
tags.description:
Provider Vetting API offered by 4i System offers the following checks.

- Medicare Enrollment Status: Verify if provider/supplier enrollments are active or inactive. To participate and receive payments, Model participants must have an active enrollment within PECOS. Additionally, some models will verify an individual or organization enrollment’s attributes, such as TIN and Legal Business Name.
- Sole Proprietor Status: Verify a sole proprietor’s enrollment and billing TIN relationship in PECOS. Verify the billing TIN is “linked to single entity” as per the current CPI Vetting Contractor (Acumen) logic.
- Medicare Exclusion (aka OIG) Check: Verify if a physician group or practitioner is listed in the Medicare Exclusion Database based on TIN. Some models looks for this flag and provides status for the Model participant.
- CCN Check: Some models verify the CCN of institutional facilities, SNF, FQHC, RHC, CAH method II, are enrolled in PECOS by checking the CCN link to TIN.
- Provider-Supplier List: Some models may require the Provider-Supplier list (Reassignments and employment arrangements for all CCNs and individual NPIs) for all model Participant TINs to verify that participants have annually certified.

As most of the model participants are either Part A providers or Part B physicians/suppliers, the current PECOS data APIs are used to verify all of the Part A providers and Part B physicians/suppliers. 

> The Provider Data APIs can be customized to limit to prohibited participants. Each of the CMMI models has prohibited participants for example, DMEPOS suppliers are prohibited for certain models.
